title: Canadian court grants extradition of Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto
byline: An Ontario judge has granted the extradition of a Sri Lankan gang leader arrested in Toronto last year for his alleged role in a deadly attack on a rival gang near Paris in 2022.

title: Heavy rains exceeding 100 mm in some areas
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued an advisory for heavy rains exceeding 100 mm at some places in the Northern Province and in the Anuradhapura and Puttalam districts.

title: Ministry expresses displeasure over sudden train strike
byline: The Transport and Highways Ministry expressed their displeasure over the sudden train strike launched by the Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLRSMU), which caused inconvenience to the public.

title: Moody’s cuts America’s pristine credit rating, citing rising debt
byline: Moody’s downgraded the U.S. sovereign credit rating on Friday due to concerns about the nation’s growing, $36 trillion debt pile, in a move that could complicate President Donald Trump’s efforts to cut taxes and send ripples through global markets.

title: CEB seeks 18.3% power tariff increase
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has sought a power tariff increase of 18.3 percent from June to December 2025.

title: SJB, UNP could have secured CMC if they contested together
byline: The United National Party (UNP) would have secured the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) if both parties, the UNP and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) had contested the local government polls together, a CMC opposition candidate said.

title: Foreign Minister requests Israeli amnesty for Sri Lankan workers facing visa issues
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath has requested the Israeli government to grant amnesty to Sri Lankans who have faced various difficulties due to visa expirations over several years and to integrate them into the workforce.

title: Drug addicts among Homagama Hospital minor employees
byline: Residents of the area expressed concern about the drug addicts among minor employees of Homagama Base Hospital, which affected the efficiency of the services, creating hardship for the patients.

title: Deputy Defence Minister to grace this year, but not President
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara, instead of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, is to grace the 16th National War Heroes Commemoration Ceremony on May 19, 2025, at the National War Hero Cenotaph in Sri Jayawardenepura, Kotte

title: Vehicle auctioning caused massive losses; Dayasiri to go to Bribery Commission
byline: Claiming that the government has incurred a massive loss through the selling of the state vehicles, MP Dayasiri Jayasekara said he will lodge a complaint with the Bribery Commission over the matter.

title: Police arrest motorcyclist who chased and shot youth in Mt. Lavinia
byline: The rider of the two motorcycle gunmen, who chased after a 19-year-old youth and shot him to death in broad daylight, near Sylvester Road in Mt. Lavinia on May 5 has been arrested yesterday (16), police said.

title: Salt prices not a matter to be taken with a pinch of salt
byline: Sri Lanka, currently facing a severe salt shortage and salt prices increasing rapidly, 1 kilogram packets of crystal salt reportedly being sold at prices ranging between Rs. 450 and Rs. 500 in some areas are expected to reduce drastically as the Cabinet of Ministers has approved the importation of salt from India, an official said.

title: Ministry urges public to stop sharing sensitive images of children on social media
byline: The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has urged the public to refrain from sharing social media posts containing images of children being circulated via a Facebook account under the name Nuwan Sandakelum.

title: Sixteen dead after tornadoes tear through US states
byline: At least 16 people are reported to have died after tornadoes tore through parts of two US states.

title: Shooting reported targeting Thusitha Halloluwa
byline: A shooting incident has been reported targeting former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa.

title: Gampola trader with Rs.7.5 Mn worth illicit cigarettes nabbed at BIA
byline: A local businessman who tried to smuggle in foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 7.5 million from Dubai was arrested by the Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: Vehicle sale adhered to govt’s open tender procedure; PMD refutes misleading reports
byline: The government today refuted reports regarding the second phase of the vehicle sale conducted through a tender process by the Presidential Secretariat on May 15, claiming that all procedures related to this sale were carried out in accordance with the Asset Management Circular 05/2024.
